chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. MANGAN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Obstruct Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct at Funeral, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.011(2)(c)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

timeConds.notes:
Twenty (20) days in the county jail, under the Huber Law, on count 4 only.

Additional forty (40) days jail, under the Huber Law, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court, on count 4 only.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Attorney Heather Richmond to Judge Rohrer with character letters attached.
Letter from Attorney Heather Richmond to Judge Rohrer with the "Life Portfolio" prepared by the defendant attached.

Motion to Adjourn Sentencing Hearing.
Cover letter.
Sentencing hearing on May 26, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Not guilty verdicts - unsigned.

Guilty verdicts on resisting an officer (Question:  Since you have found the defendant guilty of resisting an officer you must answer the following question, did the State prove beyond a reasonable doubt that the defendant caused a soft tissue injury to an officer?  Answer:  NO), obstruct officer, disorderly conduct and disrupting a funeral or memorial service.
Question from jury.

Exhibit #2 - Copy of Google map with compass and scale marked by Officer Kamp.
Exhibit #3 - Copy of Google map with compass and scale marked by defendant.

JURY TRIAL - DAY TWO
Exhibit #2 - Copy of Google map with compass and scale marked by Officer Kamp, marked, offered and received.
Exhibit #3 - Copy of Google map with compass and scale marked by defendant, marked, offered and received.
The defendant is found GUILTY of resisting an officer by the jury
Question:  Since you have found the defendant guilty of resisting an officer you must answer the following question, did the State prove beyond a reasonable doubt that the defendant caused a soft tissue injury to an officer?  Answer:  NO.
The defendant is found GUILTY of obstruct officer by the jury.
The defendant is found GUILTY of disorderly conduct by the jury.
The defendant is found GUILTY of disrupting a funeral or memorial service by the jury.
State moves for judgments on the verdicts.
Attorney Richmond requests the Court set aside the verdicts on all four counts.
Court respectfully denies the motion and finds a reasonable jury would come to the same conclusions this jury did and receives the verdicts.
The Court enters judgments of conviction as follows:
Resisting an officer contrary to Wis. Stat.  946.41(1), a Class A misdemeanor.
Obstructing an officer contrary to Wis. Stat.  946.41(1).
Disorderly conduct contrary to Wis. Stat.  947.01.
Disrupting a funeral or memorial service contrary to Wis. Stat.  947.011(2)(c)1.
Attorney Richmond asks if the Court will be revoking his current bond.
Due to the nature of the convictions the Court will not revoke defendant's bond but if there are any allegations of criminal behavior, the Court will revoke bail immediately.
Sentencing hearing set for 04-06-17 at 10:30 a.m.
At that time the Court will also set 15 CF 174 for trial.
Minutes.
Exhibit #1 - Copy of Google map of Catholic cemetery.
Courtroom Jury List.
Random Listing of Jurors.

ISSUES PRIOR TO TRIAL-
Attorney LaBre clarified some of defendant's motions in limine.
Court addresses statements may be introduced regarding statements defendant made.  Court has not received a motion to suppress defendant's statements.  There is no Miranda/Goodchild issue and defendant waives the Miranda rights with no motion to suppress.  Defendant is in agreement and confirms he will not challenge any statements made that day.
Each counsel have no objections to the others' motions in limine.  Court grants counsels' motions in limine.

JURY TRIAL - DAY ONE
Jury selected.
Testimony presented.
Exhibit #1 - Copy of Google map of Catholic cemetary,  marked, offered and received.
Minutes.
Proposed Verdict forms.
Defense Proposed Jury Instructions.

Offer has been made by the State.
Defendant rejects the offer.
Defense has no issue with the State's motion in limine.  Court grants the State's motion in limine.

Order Modifying Bail.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant cannot leave Manitowoc County except for legal proceedings, medical appointments and to go to his residence in Sheboygan County.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Order Modifying Bail.   
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's motion to modify bond to allow travel within Wisconsin is granted.  Mr. Mangan may not leave the State of Wisconsin, and if he engages in disorderly conduct, including disorderly behavior resulting in the issuance of a municipal citiation, the travel restrictions limiing his travel to within Manitowoc County, will be reinstated.  
Cover Letter.

Preliminary hearing held.  Probable cause found.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.   
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 06-03-15 at 1:30 p.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.   
BAIL MOTION
Counsel argue.  Court will remove his previously ordered condition and modify bail as follows:  Defendant cannot leave the State of Wisconsin.  He can leave the county, however, if he picks up any charges or any ordinance discorderly conduct anywhere in the State, court will restrict him to traveling only within the county.  All other conditions remain in effect.  
Minutes.

It is hereby ordered, pursuant to the above stipulation and based upon the parties' assertions, the Michael Mangan is allowed to travel to Sheboygan County for a 2:05 p.m. medical appointment on April 20, 2015.

Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.
Ann Larson, public defender.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 04-22-15 at 1:30 p.m.   Defense counsel is asking for an amendment of the bond regarding travel outside the county.  State is not opposing.  Court will amend defendant's condition of bond to allow travel within the State of Wisconsin for the purpose of work only.   
Minutes.
Request and Response Re: Copies for Mary Spicuzza

Defendant in custody.   
The matter is continued for initial appearance on 04-06-15 at 2:30 p.m.  
Court sets bail at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant have no contact with the Casper family; Defendant must remain in Manitowoc County and not travel outside the county unless prior approval of the Court; Should competency become an issue, defendant must comply with any examinations and orders; and Defendant is to have no contact with any school building in the City of Kiel or City Hall unless he has business.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.  
Minutes.
